page.title: 19Tree survey of Crockenhil.
page.content: In 1982,8 villages identified,measured and mapped every tree,hedge, and wood within a two mile radius of the village.In 1983 200 copies of a Report were printed with a grant from the Wild Flower society.Many have been sold far beyond the boundaries of Kent.We found that within the village were many fine Victorian and Edwardian trees and beyond ancient pollards and hedges were relic wood boundaries which were left after the woods them selves had grubbed up . There are many threats to trees here. Few woods remain and they are neglected.Many hedges have been grubbed up or are being damaged by farming operations.Planning applications or the individual vagaries of housesholders threaten other trees.In 1983 Crockenhill won the Kent"Trees in Your village comp."
